text: melon and prosciutto is a classic
combination it's like milk and cookies
match made in heaven I have a twist on
that old classic it's grilled and
finished with lime juice it just makes
it even more refreshing and delicious
start with your melon I have a
cantaloupe here lop off the ends first
and that gives you a nice anchor and
then take a sharp knife to quickly
remove the skin down the sides just
follow the shape of the melon right
around and you'll see that it comes
right off so have the melon and scoop
out the seeds I like to use a spoon here
and then we're gonna cut little wedges
to skewer just cut thin wedges this is
not an exact science but you don't want
it too thick because you want a nice
balance of sweet melon and salty meat
soak your skewers in water this will
prevent them from burning on the grill
don't want a good 20 to 30 minutes in
the water before you skewer them I'm
just gonna join these with our other
melons here you can see that this is
very quick and easy and it's a real
crowd-pleaser kids and adults alike will
love it grilling the melon and meat just
intensifies the flavor and gives it a
nice gentle smoky quality I have three
types of meat here I like to mix it up
classic of course is prosciutto and
depending on what part of the leg it's
from if it's thicker like this where
you're toward the middle of the leg or
the thigh end slice it in half
lengthwise to give it an appropriate
size and just wrap it right around the
meat couldn't be simpler than that so
that's the classic combo and for the
honeydew I like sopressata it's a little
peppery a little spicy you could also do
capicola here and super Sox's also has a
nice fattiness which works well against
the crisp cool honeydew melon and my
very favorite bridge ole this is
actually beef and it's air cured it has
a really mellow flavor the brazil is an
air dried beef so it's earth
thie and mello it's not smokey at all
and it's not very salty so it offers a
nice counterpoint to the watermelon
all right the grill is preheated and I
think we're ready to put these guys on
they'll be done in a flash
okay our grill is feeling nice and hot I
like to do the hand test to check for
heat these cook very quickly so do not
walk away from the grill 1 to 2 minutes
per side you're just looking for nice
grill marks and I don't think we'll fit
all of these on so we'll probably have
to do them in batches the smell from
that meat hitting the grill is instant
and it is also what you want these make
for great snack or an appetizer before
dinner yep that's it you can see how
quickly that's already taken color and
again 1 to 2 minutes on the second side
ok these are looking nice I'm gonna
start taking these off YUM it smells so
good these are ready to serve I do like
to put them on a platter first it makes
for a prettier presentation than a metal
tray it's fun to arrange them by color
it looks like we're gonna get three of
each here and the finishing touch is
freshly squeezed lime juice this really
just lightens it up gives it a burst of
freshness and citrus flavor and if
you're presenting these at a cocktail
party you can also provide a toothpick
return using the lime so what you do is
you just trim off the bottom to flatten
it and make it stable and your guests
have an easy little toothpick return
it's just a few minutes on the grill and
a squeeze of lime you have a classic
combination made even better
